intro: Cuphea trisperma, commonly known as the three-seeded cuphea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lythraceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. Cuphea trisperma is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil conditions.
